header.name: chaos/preprocessor/seq/fold_left.h
header.author: Paul Mensonides
header.overview: The header defines an algorithm that accumulates the elements of a from the first element to the last element.

macro.abstract: The macro accumulates the elements of its second argument with the operation specified by its first argument.

param.para:
The operation that is to be used to accumulate the elements of seq. This operation must be either a or a macro name that refers to a macro with a signature compatible with the following pseudo-signature:
op(s, elem†, state‡)
† The elem pseudo-parameter must be the number of parameters that corresponds to the arity of each element in seq.
‡ The state pseudo-parameter must be either ... or the number of parameters that corresponds to the number of arguments in the auxiliary data, __VA_ARGS__.

macro.para:
The macro itself expands to a in terms of (s). This , when invoked by , expands to the result of accumulating the elements of seq, from left to right, with the user-specified operation. This is illustrated by the following pseudo-code:
op(s, seq[length(seq) - 1], ... op(s, seq[1], op(s, seq[0], state) ) ... )

An invocation of the operation with the current (s), a particular element (elem), and the current state (state or __VA_ARGS__) expands to a new state used in the accumulation of subsequent elements (or as the final result of the algorithm if no further elements exist). The operation may also expand to a in terms of (s) that expands to a new state. Expansion to a allows the operation to recurse on itself if necessary.
Invocations of the operation are trampolined such that each invocation is invoked with ((s)), where s is the original at the beginning of the algorithm (i.e. ()). This maximizes the utility of the .
